articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China cut its one-year benchmark lending rate on Monday, as expected, as authorities seek to ramp up efforts to stimulate credit demand, but surprised markets by keeping the five-year rate unchanged.
articles.title: China cuts 1-year lending benchmark but keeps 5-year unchanged

articles.author: Chen Aizhu, Emily Chow, Marwa Rashad
articles.description: China's liquefied natural (LNG) gas importers are starting up or expanding trading desks in London and Singapore to better manage their growing and diversified supply portfolios in an increasingly volatile global market.
articles.title: China LNG buyers expand trading after adding more US, Qatari contracts

articles.author: Wayne Cole
articles.description: Asian markets stumbled on Monday after China delivered a smaller cut to lending rates than markets had counted on, continuing Beijing's run of disappointing stimulus steps.
articles.title: Asia stutters as China doles out meagre rate cut

articles.author: Tom Westbrook
articles.description: The dollar began on a firm footing on Monday, following five straight weeks of gains, as investors looked ahead to the Federal Reserve's Jackson Hole symposium for a guide on where rates might settle when the dust of this hiking cycle clears.
articles.title: Dollar gains intact as China disappoints, traders eye Jackson Hole

articles.author: Florence Tan
articles.description: Oil prices were steady on Monday with Brent staying above $80 a barrel, as investors balanced tightening supply driven by OPEC+ cuts with nagging concerns about global demand growth amid high interest rates.
articles.title: Oil prices flat as rates anxiety, China gloom offset tighter supply

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thailand's economy expanded slower than expected in the second quarter, data showed on Monday, with strength in tourism helping to counter weaker exports amid a slowdown in global demand.
articles.title: Thai Q2 GDP grows below forecast at 1.8%, outlook trimmed

articles.author: Alasdair Pal
articles.description: Unions at Woodside Energy Group's (WDS.AX) North West Shelf offshore gas platforms on Sunday announced plans to strike as early as Sept. 2, which could eventually disrupt shipments of liquefied natural gas (LNG) from top global exporter Australia.
articles.title: Unions notify Woodside they may strike at key Australia gas platforms

articles.author: Drazen Jorgic
articles.description: Tropical storm Hilary made landfall over the Baja California peninsula on Sunday, pelting the region with intense rain and heading toward the U.S. Southwest, where forecasters warned of life-threatening and "catastrophic" flooding.
articles.title: Hilary makes landfall over Baja California peninsula, set to pummel US Southwest

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former U.S. President Donald Trump on Sunday said he would skip the upcoming Republican primary debates, citing his large lead in opinion polls as evidence that he was already well-known and liked by voters ahead of the 2024 election.
articles.title: Trump says he won't take part in Republican debates

articles.author: Denny Thomas
articles.description: Canada is sending armed forces to tackle fast-spreading wildfires in British Columbia, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said on Sunday, as the western province deals with flames that have put more than 35,000 people under evacuation order.
articles.title: Canada to deploy armed forces in British Columbia to tackle fast-spreading fires
